description: Detailed location file for The Hollows - Tier 0-2 Starting District

location.name: The Hollows

building_types.description: Massive brick structures, 4-8 stories, broken windows patched with plastic sheeting, walls covered in graffiti and rust
Brutalist concrete, narrow corridors, flickering fluorescent lights, mold climbing walls
Stacked and welded into makeshift apartments, corrugated metal walls, condensation dripping, no insulation
Cramped storefronts, security grates (always down), neon signs (half broken), awnings patched with tarp

infrastructure_condition.roads: Cracked asphalt, potholes filled with toxic rainwater, trash accumulation in gutters
infrastructure_condition.lighting: Sodium vapor streetlights (60% functional), flickering neon, illegal LED strips, darkness pools between lights
infrastructure_condition.utilities: Spotty power (rolling blackouts 2-3x daily), contaminated water (boil advisory permanent), sewage backup frequent
infrastructure_condition.transit: One functional subway line (overcrowded, unreliable), bus stops (vandalized, schedules meaningless)

visual.skyline: Low-rise (no towers), dominated by factory smokestacks, distant corpo towers visible (mocking reminder)
visual.ground_level: Trash drifts against walls, steam rising from grates, puddles reflect broken neon, cables crisscross overhead
visual.fog: Rolls in from ocean (morning, evening), mixes with industrial smog

sight: Graffiti everywhere: tags, political slogans ('THE SYSTEM CONSUMES'), memorial murals
People in worn clothing, visible cheap chrome, faces tired/wary
Courier runners darting through crowds, parkour across rooftops
Repo trucks prowling (everyone tenses when they appear)
sound: Sirens (corpo security, ambulances, never for residents)
Children playing (rare laughter in grim environment)
Hovercraft overhead (corpo traffic, doesn't land here)
smell: Cooking food (street vendors - synthetic protein, spices masking flavor)
touch_feel: Grimy surfaces (everything coated in pollutant residue)
Uneven ground (watch your step, broken pavement)
Cold in winter (no heating), sweltering in summer (no AC)
taste_ambient: Public water tastes like rust and chlorine
Food tastes of synthetic protein and desperation

day.description: Harsh industrial light, no escape from reality

dusk.description: Neon begins, colors soften edges, brief beauty

night.description: Darkness with neon pools, shadows dangerous

weather.rain: Frequent, toxic (don't let it touch skin long), floods low streets
weather.fog: Ocean fog + industrial smog = thick soup (hard to see, easy to hide)
weather.summer: Sweltering, humidity oppressive, no AC, people on rooftops to breathe
weather.winter: Biting cold, no heating, people huddle, share warmth

soundscape.base_layer: Factory machinery hum (omnipresent, you stop noticing)
soundscape.mid_layer: Crowd noise, multilingual chatter, vendors, arguments
soundscape.silence: Rare, unsettling when it happens (blackout, evacuation, death)

population_breakdown.description: Factory workers, service industry, gig economy
Tier 0-2 couriers (The Hollows is training ground)
Unable to work, no corpo support
Growing up in poverty, futures limited

demographics.ethnic_diversity: Extremely diverse (immigrants, refugees, displaced climate migrants)

notes: Most have basic work augments (survival necessity)
Many in augment debt (can't afford payments)
Repo teams frequent (predatory lending targets Hollows)
Visible chrome = mix of necessity and aspiration

controllers.description: Own factories, housing blocks. Extract labor, provide minimal services. Don't police directly (too expensive). Repo teams when profits threatened.
Protection racket, violent but somewhat predictable
Augment black market, fill power vacuum corps leave
Attempting to organize workers, corpo-suppressed but persistent. Mutual aid networks. Lopez's early organizing happens here.
Chen's dispatch office (central Hollows). Only reliable employment for unskilled. Rating system as meritocracy myth. Gateway to climbing tiers.

activities: Factory shifts change (crowds flooding streets)
Couriers collect morning deliveries (Tier 0-1 couriers rush to Chen's dispatch)
Street vendors set up (breakfast: synthetic eggs, instant noodles)
Children go to crumbling public schools (if they go at all)
Factory hum (constant background)
Markets bustling (haggling, trading, bartering)
Couriers running deliveries (crisscross district constantly)
Elderly sitting on stoops (watching, remembering better times)
Repo teams prowl (people hide when they appear)
Second factory shift (night workers trudge in)
Street food peak (people eat standing, cheap and fast)
Couriers return to dispatch (turn in packages, count credits)
Bars fill (cheap alcohol, escape for a few hours)
Gangs emerge (protection collections, territory marking)
Most retreat indoors (not safe)
Night shift workers only people on streets
Illegal chrome surgeries (back-alley clinics)
Drug trade (synth-opiates, augment stims)
Occasional violence (gangs, desperate people)
Couriers rarely work nights (too dangerous)

survival_code: Don't snitch to corpo: Community before authority
Help your neighbors: Mutual aid is survival
Respect the couriers: They might help you someday
Avoid gangs but pay protection: Resistance gets you hurt
Watch for repo trucks: Warn others if you see them
unspoken_rules: Don't ask about chrome debt (everyone has it, it's shameful)
Share food if you have extra (you might need help tomorrow)
Don't trust corpo promises (everyone learned this lesson)
Celebrate small victories (Tier advancement, successful delivery)
Mourn the fallen (memorial murals for dead couriers)

key_locations.name: Chen's Dispatch Office
key_locations.description: Basement of converted factory. Holographic job board (flickering). Chen's office (cluttered, coffee-stained).

key_locations.name: Tanaka's Clinic
key_locations.description: Underground medical facility. Clean despite surroundings (Tanaka's obsession). Ethical practitioner.

key_locations.name: Rosa's Mechanic Shop
key_locations.description: Garage specializing in courier gear. Rosa's apartment above shop. Romance scenes location.

key_locations.name: Hollows Market
key_locations.description: Open-air bazaar. Street vendors, food stalls, chrome dealers. Crowds, noise, sensory overload. Pickpockets, scammers, genuine traders mixed.

key_locations.name: The Gutters
key_locations.description: Lowest income area (shipping container housing). Where player's starting apartment is located. Dangerous but community tight-knit. Visible chrome repossessions happen here.
key_locations.narrative_role: Player starting location, chrome repo scenes

key_locations.name: Old Factory #7
key_locations.description: Active factory, exploitative conditions. Union organizing attempts. Background for worker struggle theme.
key_locations.narrative_role: Potential side quest location, union storyline

navigation.ground_routes: Crowded, slow, lots of obstacles (people, trash, broken pavement)
navigation.rooftop_routes: Faster, risky (gaps, unstable structures), requires mobility augments
navigation.alley_shortcuts: Dangerous (gangs, ambushes), fast if you know them
navigation.subway: Unreliable, crowded, pickpockets, but covers distance

resources.notes: Available but dangerous (back-alley installs, no warranty)

resources.sources: Gossip, tips, warnings (talk to NPCs for intel)

resources.notes: Neighbors will help (if you've helped them)

corpo_exploitation_visible: Nakamura logo on factory walls (owners displayed proudly)
Pay stubs on ground (wages barely subsistence)
chrome_culture: Repo scars (people with chrome extraction marks)
Makeshift charging stations (share power, community support)
failed_dreams: Boarded buildings (people displaced, nowhere to go)

ambient_npcs.dialogue: Synthetic protein bowls! Hot and filling! Only 5 credits! Real spicesâ€”well, almost real!
Used to be factories made things people needed. Now they make profits. We just happen to work there.
Another day. Another dollar. Another step closer to the chrome I can't afford. Then they'll repo it anyway. What's the point?
I'm getting out of here. Tier 2 next month, guaranteed. Then Red Harbor. Then Uptown. Then... anywhere but here.
Stay away from the repo trucks. And don't talk to strangers offering easy chrome. Those debts will eat you alive.
Meeting tonight. Basement of Factory 7. We're organizing a work stoppage. Tell who you trust. Only who you trust.

main_story.name: Provisional
main_story.description: Meet Delilah, moral choice with package

themes.name: Grinding Desperation
themes.description: Everyone is tired, trapped, surviving day-to-day

themes.name: Fragile Community
themes.description: People help each other because they must

themes.name: Bitter Hope
themes.description: Some still believe escape is possible (mostly young couriers)

themes.name: Resignation
themes.description: Most have accepted this is their life

themes.name: Quiet Anger
themes.description: System exploitation visible, revolution suppressed but simmering

player_emotional_arc.description: This is suffocating, I need out
I'll escape, I'll climb, I'll prove I can
I made it out, they didn't, system's still crushing them
This is where I started, where I learned, where I survived

transition.chen_dialogue: You're ready for Red Harbor. More money, more danger. The Hollows will always be here if you fail. Try not to fail.
transition.npc_acknowledgement: You're leaving. Good. Get out while you can.
return_reactions: Look who's back. Too good for us now? (joking, proud)
New couriers at Chen's (Tier 0s, where you started)
Bittersweet: You escaped, they're still trapped

poverty_is_expensive: Cheap augments break, expensive to repair
Can't afford good gear, die more, lose money
Debt trap visible at ground level
community_is_survival: No one escapes alone (even player needs Chen, Rosa, Tanaka)
Mutual aid networks keep people alive
But community can't fix structural problems

location.narrative_role: Tutorial zone, emotional baseline, thematic foundation
location.thematic_weight: Heavy (establishes system exploitation, community survival, escape motivation)
location.algorithm_flavor: DISTRICT: THE HOLLOWS. EFFICIENCY INDEX: LOW. MONITORING PRIORITY: MINIMAL.
